description: Test questions covering physics, chemistry, biology, and general science

questions.question: What is the chemical symbol for water?
What is the speed of light in vacuum?
What is the powerhouse of the cell?
What is the atomic number of carbon?
What is Newton's first law of motion?
questions.expected_answer: An object at rest stays at rest, and an object in motion stays in motion unless acted upon by an external force

questions.question: What is DNA an abbreviation for?
What is the pH of pure water?
What is the force that keeps planets in orbit around the sun?
How many bones are in the adult human body?
What is the chemical formula for table salt?
What is the largest organ in the human body?
What temperature is absolute zero in Celsius?
What is the chemical symbol for gold?
What is the process by which plants make food using sunlight?
What is the unit of electrical resistance?
What is the most abundant gas in Earth's atmosphere?
What is the smallest unit of life?
What is the formula for calculating force?
questions.expected_answer: F = ma (Force equals mass times acceleration)

questions.question: What element has the chemical symbol Fe?
What is the main function of red blood cells?
questions.expected_answer: To carry oxygen throughout the body

questions.question: What is the first law of thermodynamics?
questions.expected_answer: Energy cannot be created or destroyed, only converted from one form to another

questions.question: What is the chemical formula for carbon dioxide?
What is the longest bone in the human body?
What is the SI unit of energy?
What is the pH range for acids?
What is the process of cell division called?
What is the formula for Einstein's mass-energy equivalence?
What is the chemical name for rust?
What is the function of hemoglobin?
questions.expected_answer: To carry oxygen in the blood

questions.question: What is the wavelength range of visible light?
What is the noble gas with atomic number 2?
What is the human body's normal temperature in Celsius?
What is the SI unit of frequency?
What is the process of a solid turning directly into a gas called?
What is the name of the process where RNA is made from DNA?
What is Ohm's law?
questions.expected_answer: V = IR (Voltage equals current times resistance)

questions.question: What is the chemical symbol for sodium?
What are the four chambers of the human heart?
questions.expected_answer: Left atrium, right atrium, left ventricle, right ventricle

questions.question: What is the gravitational acceleration on Earth's surface?
What is the most reactive group of elements on the periodic table?
What is the molecule that carries genetic information?
What is the SI unit of power?
What is the chemical formula for methane?
What is the largest artery in the human body?
What are the three states of matter?
What is the valency of carbon?
What is the basic unit of the nervous system?
What is the relationship between wavelength and frequency?
What is an isotope?
questions.expected_answer: Atoms of the same element with different numbers of neutrons

questions.question: What is the process by which organisms evolve over time?
